once.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: Paul’s been to Wexford once before.
Mrs Peterson came in to see Ruth just the once.
once.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: at some time in the past, but not now
once.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: Sonya and Ida had once been close friends.
She and her husband had once owned a house like this.
It was sad to see the once-great man looking so frail.
once.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: in the past, at a time that is not stated
once.translation[0].definitions[2].examp: Marx once described religion as the ‘opium of the people’.
once.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: from the time when something happens
once.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: Once I get him a job, he’ll be fine.
Once in bed, the children usually stay there.
